description: Number of pairwise incongruent triangles with integer sides and positive integer area and second longest side of length n.
example: a(10) is 3 because there are three different integer-sided, integer-area triangles with middle side length 10, namely [9,10,17], [10,10,12], and [10,10,16].
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 26 2000
extensions: Definition corrected and offset changed by _James R. Buddenhagen_, Jan 16 2012
